trans-unit.source: Add a Message Source to the Bridge
trans-unit.target: Add a Message Source to the Bridge

trans-unit.source: Use <token>af_integration</token> to receive messages from FTP, SFTP, <token>sb2</token> Queue, and <token>sb2</token> topic subscription.
trans-unit.target: Use <token>af_integration</token> to receive messages from FTP, SFTP, <token>sb2</token> Queue, and <token>sb2</token> topic subscription.

trans-unit.source: These ‘sources’ are in addition to sending and receiving messages to and from HTTP endpoints.
trans-unit.target: These ‘sources’ are in addition to sending and receiving messages to and from HTTP endpoints.

trans-unit.source: This topic lists the topics to add and configure the sources from where a <token>bridge</token> can receive messages.
trans-unit.target: This topic lists the topics to add and configure the sources from where a <token>bridge</token> can receive messages.

trans-unit.source: The sources can be used as a message source for an <token>one-way</token> or a <token>passthru</token>.
trans-unit.target: The sources can be used as a message source for an <token>one-way</token> or a <token>passthru</token>.

trans-unit.source: These sources cannot be used a source for <token>request_response</token>.
trans-unit.target: These sources cannot be used a source for <token>request_response</token>.

trans-unit.source: In this topic:
trans-unit.target: In this topic:

trans-unit.source: These steps assume you’ve created <token>msgflow_proj</token>.
trans-unit.target: These steps assume you’ve created <token>msgflow_proj</token>.

trans-unit.source: See <link xlink:href="03421690-817a-45a8-8492-c9cb98484102" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">How to Create a Message Flow Project</link>.
trans-unit.target: See <link xlink:href="03421690-817a-45a8-8492-c9cb98484102" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">How to Create a Message Flow Project</link>.

trans-unit.source: Add an FTP Source
trans-unit.target: Add an FTP Source

trans-unit.source: You can explicitly start or stop the FTP source (which controls polling of the FTP location) without requiring the configuration of the bridge to be changed.
trans-unit.target: You can explicitly start or stop the FTP source (which controls polling of the FTP location) without requiring the configuration of the bridge to be changed.

trans-unit.source: Open your <token>msgflow_proj</token>.
trans-unit.target: Open your <token>msgflow_proj</token>.

trans-unit.source: Right-click anywhere on the <token>msgflow_proj</token> design area, select <embeddedLabel>Properties</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: Right-click anywhere on the <token>msgflow_proj</token> design area, select <embeddedLabel>Properties</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: For the <embeddedLabel>BizTalk Service URL</embeddedLabel> property, enter your <token>af_integration</token> URL.
trans-unit.target: For the <embeddedLabel>BizTalk Service URL</embeddedLabel> property, enter your <token>af_integration</token> URL.

trans-unit.source: From the <embeddedLabel>Toolbox</embeddedLabel>, drag and drop the <embeddedLabel>FTP Source</embeddedLabel> component to the <token>msgflow_proj</token> design area.
trans-unit.target: From the <embeddedLabel>Toolbox</embeddedLabel>, drag and drop the <embeddedLabel>FTP Source</embeddedLabel> component to the <token>msgflow_proj</token> design area.

trans-unit.source: Right-click the component and select <embeddedLabel>Properties</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: Right-click the component and select <embeddedLabel>Properties</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: The following table describes these properties:
trans-unit.target: The following table describes these properties:

trans-unit.source: Property
trans-unit.target: Property

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Content Encoding
trans-unit.target: Content Encoding

trans-unit.source: Enter the character encoding of the message.
trans-unit.target: Enter the character encoding of the message.

trans-unit.source: Default is UTF8.
trans-unit.target: Default is UTF8.

trans-unit.source: Options include:
trans-unit.target: Options include:

trans-unit.source: UTF8
trans-unit.target: UTF8

trans-unit.source: UTF16
trans-unit.target: UTF16

trans-unit.source: UTF16BE
trans-unit.target: UTF16BE

trans-unit.source: ASCII
trans-unit.target: ASCII

trans-unit.source: Content Type
trans-unit.target: Content Type

trans-unit.source: Enter Text or XML as the message file type.
trans-unit.target: Enter Text or XML as the message file type.

trans-unit.source: Default is Text.
trans-unit.target: Default is Text.

trans-unit.source: Entity Name
trans-unit.target: Entity Name

trans-unit.source: Enter a unique and descriptive name of the FTP Source component.
trans-unit.target: Enter a unique and descriptive name of the FTP Source component.

trans-unit.source: File Mask
trans-unit.target: File Mask

trans-unit.source: Enter a File Mask to filter the messages pulled from the FTP server.
trans-unit.target: Enter a File Mask to filter the messages pulled from the FTP server.

trans-unit.source: For example, if you want to pull all XML messages, enter <ui>*.xml</ui>.
trans-unit.target: For example, if you want to pull all XML messages, enter <ui>*.xml</ui>.

trans-unit.source: Folder Path
trans-unit.target: Folder Path

trans-unit.source: Enter the folder on the FTP server that contains the messages to retrieve.
trans-unit.target: Enter the folder on the FTP server that contains the messages to retrieve.

trans-unit.source: For example, if you want to pull all XML messages in the CustomerFiles\Contoso FTP folder, enter <ui>CustomerFiles\Contoso</ui>.
trans-unit.target: For example, if you want to pull all XML messages in the CustomerFiles\Contoso FTP folder, enter <ui>CustomerFiles\Contoso</ui>.

trans-unit.source: FTP Transfer Mode
trans-unit.target: FTP Transfer Mode

trans-unit.source: Enter Binary or ASCII as the Transfer Mode.
trans-unit.target: Enter Binary or ASCII as the Transfer Mode.

trans-unit.source: Default is Binary.
trans-unit.target: Default is Binary.

trans-unit.source: For example, if the messages only contain text-type of data, select ASCII.
trans-unit.target: For example, if the messages only contain text-type of data, select ASCII.

trans-unit.source: If the messages contain any type of data, select Binary.
trans-unit.target: If the messages contain any type of data, select Binary.

trans-unit.source: Initial Status
trans-unit.target: Initial Status

trans-unit.source: Enter Stop or Start for the FTP Source.
trans-unit.target: Enter Stop or Start for the FTP Source.

trans-unit.source: Default is Start.
trans-unit.target: Default is Start.

trans-unit.source: For example, if you want the FTP Source component to be started when the <token>msgflow_proj</token> is deployed, select Start.
trans-unit.target: For example, if you want the FTP Source component to be started when the <token>msgflow_proj</token> is deployed, select Start.

trans-unit.source: If you set the initial status to stop, you can later start the source using the PowerShell cmdlet.
trans-unit.target: If you set the initial status to stop, you can later start the source using the PowerShell cmdlet.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link xlink:href="1e87cfa5-c7e6-4956-bd06-c55838706da6" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Start-AzureBizTalkBridgeSource</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link xlink:href="1e87cfa5-c7e6-4956-bd06-c55838706da6" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Start-AzureBizTalkBridgeSource</link>.

trans-unit.source: Password
trans-unit.target: Password

trans-unit.source: Enter the username password that can retrieve files from the FTP server.
trans-unit.target: Enter the username password that can retrieve files from the FTP server.

trans-unit.source: Server Address
trans-unit.target: Server Address

trans-unit.source: Enter the FTP server name or IP address.
trans-unit.target: Enter the FTP server name or IP address.

trans-unit.source: Server Port
trans-unit.target: Server Port

trans-unit.source: Enter the FTP server port.
trans-unit.target: Enter the FTP server port.

trans-unit.source: Default is 21 and is typically used for FTP.
trans-unit.target: Default is 21 and is typically used for FTP.

trans-unit.source: Use SSL
trans-unit.target: Use SSL

trans-unit.source: Select True if the connection to the FTP server must use SSL.
trans-unit.target: Select True if the connection to the FTP server must use SSL.

trans-unit.source: Username
trans-unit.target: Username

trans-unit.source: Enter the username that can retrieve files from the FTP server.
trans-unit.target: Enter the username that can retrieve files from the FTP server.

trans-unit.source: From the File menu, select <embeddedLabel>Save</embeddedLabel>
trans-unit.target: From the File menu, select <embeddedLabel>Save</embeddedLabel>

trans-unit.source: <link xlink:href="81b3d264-667e-4fe0-bbdd-14293cedd9da" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Configuring Bridges</link> provides details on how to configure these <token>bridge</token>s.
trans-unit.target: <link xlink:href="81b3d264-667e-4fe0-bbdd-14293cedd9da" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Configuring Bridges</link> provides details on how to configure these <token>bridge</token>s.

trans-unit.source: After you have added a bridge and the <embeddedLabel>FTP Source</embeddedLabel> component to the design area, select <ui>Connector</ui> from the Toolbox and connect the <embeddedLabel>FTP Source</embeddedLabel> to the <token>bridge</token>.
trans-unit.target: After you have added a bridge and the <embeddedLabel>FTP Source</embeddedLabel> component to the design area, select <ui>Connector</ui> from the Toolbox and connect the <embeddedLabel>FTP Source</embeddedLabel> to the <token>bridge</token>.

trans-unit.source: A bridge deployed in <token>af_integration</token> can only receive messages from an FTP server hosted in a public domain.
trans-unit.target: A bridge deployed in <token>af_integration</token> can only receive messages from an FTP server hosted in a public domain.

trans-unit.source: Add an SFTP Source
trans-unit.target: Add an SFTP Source

trans-unit.source: You can explicitly start or stop the SFTP source (which controls polling of the SFTP location) without requiring the configuration of the bridge to be changed.
trans-unit.target: You can explicitly start or stop the SFTP source (which controls polling of the SFTP location) without requiring the configuration of the bridge to be changed.

trans-unit.source: An SFTP Source polls a folder on an SFTP computer.
trans-unit.target: An SFTP Source polls a folder on an SFTP computer.

trans-unit.source: Steps to create an SFTP Source:
trans-unit.target: Steps to create an SFTP Source:

trans-unit.source: Open your <token>msgflow_proj</token>.
trans-unit.target: Open your <token>msgflow_proj</token>.

trans-unit.source: Right-click anywhere on the <token>msgflow_proj</token> design area, select <embeddedLabel>Properties</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: Right-click anywhere on the <token>msgflow_proj</token> design area, select <embeddedLabel>Properties</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: For the <embeddedLabel>BizTalk Service URL</embeddedLabel> property, enter your <token>af_integration</token> URL.
trans-unit.target: For the <embeddedLabel>BizTalk Service URL</embeddedLabel> property, enter your <token>af_integration</token> URL.

trans-unit.source: From the <embeddedLabel>Toolbox</embeddedLabel>, drag and drop the <embeddedLabel>SFTP Source</embeddedLabel> component to the <token>msgflow_proj</token> design area.
trans-unit.target: From the <embeddedLabel>Toolbox</embeddedLabel>, drag and drop the <embeddedLabel>SFTP Source</embeddedLabel> component to the <token>msgflow_proj</token> design area.

trans-unit.source: Right-click the component and select <embeddedLabel>Properties</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: Right-click the component and select <embeddedLabel>Properties</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: The following table describes these properties:
trans-unit.target: The following table describes these properties:

trans-unit.source: Property
trans-unit.target: Property

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Content Type
trans-unit.target: Content Type

trans-unit.source: Enter Text or XML as the message file type.
trans-unit.target: Enter Text or XML as the message file type.

trans-unit.source: Default is Text.
trans-unit.target: Default is Text.

trans-unit.source: Encoding
trans-unit.target: Encoding

trans-unit.source: Enter the content encoding.
trans-unit.target: Enter the content encoding.

trans-unit.source: Options include:
trans-unit.target: Options include:

trans-unit.source: UTF8
trans-unit.target: UTF8

trans-unit.source: UTF16
trans-unit.target: UTF16

trans-unit.source: UTF16BE
trans-unit.target: UTF16BE

trans-unit.source: ASCII
trans-unit.target: ASCII

trans-unit.source: Entity Name
trans-unit.target: Entity Name

trans-unit.source: Enter a unique and descriptive name of the SFTP Source component.
trans-unit.target: Enter a unique and descriptive name of the SFTP Source component.

trans-unit.source: File Mask
trans-unit.target: File Mask

trans-unit.source: Enter a File Mask to filter the messages pulled from the SFTP server.
trans-unit.target: Enter a File Mask to filter the messages pulled from the SFTP server.

trans-unit.source: For example, if you want to pull all XML messages, enter <ui>*.xml</ui>.
trans-unit.target: For example, if you want to pull all XML messages, enter <ui>*.xml</ui>.

trans-unit.source: Folder Path
trans-unit.target: Folder Path

trans-unit.source: Enter the folder on the SFTP server that contains the messages to retrieve.
trans-unit.target: Enter the folder on the SFTP server that contains the messages to retrieve.

trans-unit.source: For example, if you want to pull all XML messages in the CustomerFiles\Contoso SFTP folder, enter <ui>CustomerFiles\Contoso</ui>.
trans-unit.target: For example, if you want to pull all XML messages in the CustomerFiles\Contoso SFTP folder, enter <ui>CustomerFiles\Contoso</ui>.

trans-unit.source: Initial Status
trans-unit.target: Initial Status

trans-unit.source: Enter Stop or Start for the SFTP Source.
trans-unit.target: Enter Stop or Start for the SFTP Source.

trans-unit.source: Default is Start.
trans-unit.target: Default is Start.

trans-unit.source: When set to Start, the SFTP Source is polled for new files.
trans-unit.target: When set to Start, the SFTP Source is polled for new files.

trans-unit.source: If you want to poll the SFTP Source when the <token>msgflow_proj</token> is deployed, set to Start.
trans-unit.target: If you want to poll the SFTP Source when the <token>msgflow_proj</token> is deployed, set to Start.

trans-unit.source: If you set the initial status to stop, you can later start the source using the PowerShell cmdlet.
trans-unit.target: If you set the initial status to stop, you can later start the source using the PowerShell cmdlet.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link xlink:href="1e87cfa5-c7e6-4956-bd06-c55838706da6" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Start-AzureBizTalkBridgeSource</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link xlink:href="1e87cfa5-c7e6-4956-bd06-c55838706da6" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Start-AzureBizTalkBridgeSource</link>.

trans-unit.source: Password
trans-unit.target: Password

trans-unit.source: Enter the username password that can retrieve files from the SFTP server.
trans-unit.target: Enter the username password that can retrieve files from the SFTP server.

trans-unit.source: Server Address
trans-unit.target: Server Address

trans-unit.source: Enter the SFTP server name or IP address.
trans-unit.target: Enter the SFTP server name or IP address.

trans-unit.source: Server Port
trans-unit.target: Server Port

trans-unit.source: Enter the SFTP server port.
trans-unit.target: Enter the SFTP server port.

trans-unit.source: Default is 22.
trans-unit.target: Default is 22.

trans-unit.source: Username
trans-unit.target: Username

trans-unit.source: Enter the username that can retrieve files from the SFTP server.
trans-unit.target: Enter the username that can retrieve files from the SFTP server.

trans-unit.source: From the File menu, select <embeddedLabel>Save</embeddedLabel>
trans-unit.target: From the File menu, select <embeddedLabel>Save</embeddedLabel>

trans-unit.source: Authentication
trans-unit.target: Authentication

trans-unit.source: <legacyBold>Server Authentication</legacyBold>: The SFTP Source and SFTP Destination trust all server certificates.
trans-unit.target: <legacyBold>Server Authentication</legacyBold>: The SFTP Source and SFTP Destination trust all server certificates.

trans-unit.source: <legacyBold>Client Authentication</legacyBold>: Enter a username and password that can get/put files on the SFTP computer folder.
trans-unit.target: <legacyBold>Client Authentication</legacyBold>: Enter a username and password that can get/put files on the SFTP computer folder.

trans-unit.source: This is exactly the same as logging into an FTP server.
trans-unit.target: This is exactly the same as logging into an FTP server.

trans-unit.source: SSH File Transfer Protocol (SFTP) is a common protocol used to securely transfer files between two external partners.
trans-unit.target: SSH File Transfer Protocol (SFTP) is a common protocol used to securely transfer files between two external partners.

trans-unit.source: SFTP has become one the preferred methods to transfer files.
trans-unit.target: SFTP has become one the preferred methods to transfer files.

trans-unit.source: <token>af_integration</token> includes SFTP functionality that enables you to receive messages from an SFTP source.
trans-unit.target: <token>af_integration</token> includes SFTP functionality that enables you to receive messages from an SFTP source.

trans-unit.source: This topic lists the steps to use an SFTP server as a message source in a <token>msgflow_proj</token>.
trans-unit.target: This topic lists the steps to use an SFTP server as a message source in a <token>msgflow_proj</token>.

trans-unit.source: Use this source to pull a message from an SFTP server.
trans-unit.target: Use this source to pull a message from an SFTP server.

trans-unit.source: <link xlink:href="81b3d264-667e-4fe0-bbdd-14293cedd9da" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Configuring Bridges</link> provides details on how to configure these <token>bridge</token>s.
trans-unit.target: <link xlink:href="81b3d264-667e-4fe0-bbdd-14293cedd9da" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Configuring Bridges</link> provides details on how to configure these <token>bridge</token>s.

trans-unit.source: After you have added a bridge and the <embeddedLabel>SFTP Source</embeddedLabel> component to the design area, select <ui>Connector</ui> from the Toolbox, and connect the <embeddedLabel>SFTP Source</embeddedLabel> to the <token>bridge</token>.
trans-unit.target: After you have added a bridge and the <embeddedLabel>SFTP Source</embeddedLabel> component to the design area, select <ui>Connector</ui> from the Toolbox, and connect the <embeddedLabel>SFTP Source</embeddedLabel> to the <token>bridge</token>.

trans-unit.source: Add a queue source
trans-unit.target: Add a queue source

trans-unit.source: Open your <token>msgflow_proj</token>.
trans-unit.target: Open your <token>msgflow_proj</token>.

trans-unit.source: Right-click anywhere on the <token>msgflow_proj</token> design area, select <embeddedLabel>Properties</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: Right-click anywhere on the <token>msgflow_proj</token> design area, select <embeddedLabel>Properties</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: For the <embeddedLabel>BizTalk Service URL</embeddedLabel> property, enter your <token>af_integration</token> URL.
trans-unit.target: For the <embeddedLabel>BizTalk Service URL</embeddedLabel> property, enter your <token>af_integration</token> URL.

trans-unit.source: From the <embeddedLabel>Toolbox</embeddedLabel>, drag and drop the <embeddedLabel><token>sb2</token> Queue Source</embeddedLabel> component to the <token>msgflow_proj</token> desiger.
trans-unit.target: From the <embeddedLabel>Toolbox</embeddedLabel>, drag and drop the <embeddedLabel><token>sb2</token> Queue Source</embeddedLabel> component to the <token>msgflow_proj</token> desiger.

trans-unit.source: Right-click the component and select <embeddedLabel>Properties</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: Right-click the component and select <embeddedLabel>Properties</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: The following table provides information about the properties:
trans-unit.target: The following table provides information about the properties:

trans-unit.source: Property
trans-unit.target: Property

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Connection String
trans-unit.target: Connection String

trans-unit.source: Enter the connection string for the queue.
trans-unit.target: Enter the connection string for the queue.

trans-unit.source: The connection string is available from the <externalLink><linkText>Azure Management Portal</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=211879</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: The connection string is available from the <externalLink><linkText>Azure Management Portal</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=211879</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: Entity Name
trans-unit.target: Entity Name

trans-unit.source: Enter a unique and descriptive name of the queue source.
trans-unit.target: Enter a unique and descriptive name of the queue source.

trans-unit.source: Initil Status
trans-unit.target: Initil Status

trans-unit.source: Enter Stop or Start for the queue source.
trans-unit.target: Enter Stop or Start for the queue source.

trans-unit.source: Default is Start.
trans-unit.target: Default is Start.

trans-unit.source: For example, if you want the queue source component to be started when the <token>msgflow_proj</token> is deployed, select <embeddedLabel>Start</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: For example, if you want the queue source component to be started when the <token>msgflow_proj</token> is deployed, select <embeddedLabel>Start</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: If you set the initial status to stop, you can later start the source using the PowerShell cmdlet.
trans-unit.target: If you set the initial status to stop, you can later start the source using the PowerShell cmdlet.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link xlink:href="1e87cfa5-c7e6-4956-bd06-c55838706da6" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Start-AzureBizTalkBridgeSource</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link xlink:href="1e87cfa5-c7e6-4956-bd06-c55838706da6" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Start-AzureBizTalkBridgeSource</link>.

trans-unit.source: Queue Name
trans-unit.target: Queue Name

trans-unit.source: Name of the queue that you must have already created under your <token>sb2</token> namespace in the <token>portal</token>
trans-unit.target: Name of the queue that you must have already created under your <token>sb2</token> namespace in the <token>portal</token>

trans-unit.source: From the File menu, select <embeddedLabel>Save</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: From the File menu, select <embeddedLabel>Save</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: <link xlink:href="81b3d264-667e-4fe0-bbdd-14293cedd9da" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Configuring Bridges</link> provides details on how to configure these <token>bridge</token>s.
trans-unit.target: <link xlink:href="81b3d264-667e-4fe0-bbdd-14293cedd9da" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Configuring Bridges</link> provides details on how to configure these <token>bridge</token>s.

trans-unit.source: After you have added a bridge and the <embeddedLabel><token>sb2</token> Queue Source</embeddedLabel> component to the design area, select <ui>Connector</ui> from the Toolbox and connect the source to the <token>bridge</token>.
trans-unit.target: After you have added a bridge and the <embeddedLabel><token>sb2</token> Queue Source</embeddedLabel> component to the design area, select <ui>Connector</ui> from the Toolbox and connect the source to the <token>bridge</token>.

trans-unit.source: Add a subscription source

trans-unit.source: Open your <token>msgflow_proj</token>.
trans-unit.target: Open your <token>msgflow_proj</token>.

trans-unit.target: Right-click anywhere on the <token>msgflow_proj</token> design area and select <embeddedLabel>Properties</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: For the <embeddedLabel>BizTalk Service URL</embeddedLabel> property, enter your <token>af_integration</token> URL.

trans-unit.target: If you set the initial status to stop, you can later start the source using the PowerShell cmdlet.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link xlink:href="1e87cfa5-c7e6-4956-bd06-c55838706da6" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Start-AzureBizTalkBridgeSource</link>.

trans-unit.source: Subscription Name
trans-unit.target: Subscription Name

trans-unit.source: Name of the subscription that you must have already created for the topic, for which you specified the connection string earlier.
trans-unit.target: Name of the subscription that you must have already created for the topic, for which you specified the connection string earlier.

trans-unit.source: This should be specified in the format <legacyItalic>[TopicPath]/subscriptions/[SubscriptionName]</legacyItalic>.
trans-unit.target: This should be specified in the format <legacyItalic>[TopicPath]/subscriptions/[SubscriptionName]</legacyItalic>.

trans-unit.source: From the File menu, select <embeddedLabel>Save</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: From the File menu, select <embeddedLabel>Save</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: <link xlink:href="81b3d264-667e-4fe0-bbdd-14293cedd9da" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Configuring Bridges</link> provides details on how to configure these <token>bridge</token>s.
trans-unit.target: <link xlink:href="81b3d264-667e-4fe0-bbdd-14293cedd9da" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Configuring Bridges</link> provides details on how to configure these <token>bridge</token>s.

trans-unit.source: After you have added a bridge and the <embeddedLabel><token>sb2</token> Subscription Source</embeddedLabel> component to the design surface, select <ui>Connector</ui> from the Toolbox and connect the source to the <token>bridge</token>.
trans-unit.target: After you have added a bridge and the <embeddedLabel><token>sb2</token> Subscription Source</embeddedLabel> component to the design surface, select <ui>Connector</ui> from the Toolbox and connect the source to the <token>bridge</token>.
